Last Published: 2013-08-19

Download and Installation

To use Joda-Time you need to download the latest version. The download will contain the joda-time jar file. Once you add this to your classpath you will be able to use Joda-Time.

The binary download also includes joda-time-sources.jar, which is a jar file of the source code suitable for linking to the jar file in IDEs such as Eclipse.

The release notes for upgraders can be found here:

  • Version 2.3 - upgrade from Version 2.2
  • Version 2.2 - upgrade from Version 2.1
  • Version 2.1 - upgrade from Version 2.0
  • Version 2.0 - upgrade from Version 1.6
  • Version 1.6.2 - upgrade from Version 1.6.1
  • Version 1.6.1 - upgrade from Version 1.6
  • Version 1.6 - upgrade from Version 1.5
  • Version 1.5.2 - upgrade from Version 1.5.1
  • Version 1.5.1 - upgrade from Version 1.5
  • Version 1.5 - upgrade from Version 1.4
  • Version 1.4 - upgrade from Version 1.3
  • Version 1.3 - upgrade from Version 1.2
  • Version 1.2 - upgrade from Version 1.1
  • Version 1.1 - upgrade from Version 1.0
  • Version 1.0 - upgrade from Version 0.99
  • Version 0.99 - upgrade from Version 0.98

If you want to build Joda-Time from source you will need Apache Ant or Apache Maven. Search to find out more about building using those tools.
